content: up in a ruffle and secure with a few stitches rolled rose using 4mm needles makes a smaller rose for a slightly larger rose use 4 5mm needles cast on 10st row 1 knit row 2 and alternate row purl row 3 kfb into each stitch 20st row 5 kfb into each stitch 40st row 7 kfb into each stitch 80st at this point the stitches get very tight and it would be very difficult to keep doubling the number of stitches any further row 8 purl cast off loosely starting at one end of the work roll up into a rose shape with the wrong side facing out secure with a few stitches making sure you go through all the layers large flower with 4mm needles cast on 100st row 1 knit row 2 and all alternate row purl row 3 k2tog across the row 50st row 5 k2tog across the row 25st row 7 k2tog across the row to the last st k1 13st row 9 k1 k2tog across the row 7st break yarn thread onto a darning needle and thread through the remaining stitches pull tight and secure sew the side seams centre cast on 25st row 1 knit row 2 purl row 3 k2tog across the row to the last st k1 13st row 4 k1 k2tog across the row 7st break yarn thread onto a darning needle and thread through the remaining stitches pull tight and secure sew the side seams sew the 2 layers together in the centre finishing off with a button
